content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Sure! Here is a possible implementation of the `clean_column` function in Julia:
```
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    col = lowercase(col) # lowercase the column name
    col = trim(col) # strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = replace(col, " \\" => "_") # replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    return col # return the cleaned-up column name
end
```
Note that `trim` is a built-in function in Julia that removes leading and trailing whitespaces from a string. The `replace` function replaces a pattern (in this case, spaces and hyphens) with a replacement string (an underscore).
